name: Clanree Hotel

reviews.text: Well spent 2 nights here at The Clanree Hotel and must say the best thing was booking out.
reviews.title: A smile costs nothing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Many staff could not even smile, in 2012 when times are tough smiles don't cost anything but make people feel welcome. Food was just ok nothing that would make us come back for more.
reviews.title: dreadful

reviews.text: The second day we eat from a buger van and that was better, good fun a buger and chips in the rain hard to beat. Into Letterkenny nice people and great views to be seen. Please Clanree wake up the days of giving poor service for high rates and getting away with it have long gone. Best view of this hotel is in your rear view mirror. Sorry Clanree will given Letterkenny another weekend stay but not with you.
reviews.title: Interesting

reviews.text: we stayed at this hotel last summer and this was the first and last time the staff i found to be cold and impersonal the rooms dank and smelly,there seemed to be a country fest on in the ballroom anytime we went to the toilet there were gangs of very young girls drinking out of bottles of vodka in the toilets, but the breakfast i can only compare it to a communal dining room in a 1970s holiday camp with the complete bar area piled up with unwashed glasses from the night before ,we would be regular visitors to letterkenny and so happy that we have since discovered the stationhouse hotel at the end of the main street ..
reviews.title: Nice place but not my favorite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here two nights ago. On checking in I saw a guy get turned away as there were a lot of tours in, and the hotel was full. Thankfully I had been pre booked. The room was quite large, but the view was awful. Another of those rooms at the back overlooking a flat roof with ducting all over the place which obscured everything else. The entrance hallway in the room had no light, so it was hard to see the air con controls positioned just inside the door. There was a couch at the far side of the room from the tv so you need good eyesight. The bed was very comfortable. The window didn't open much. €4.10 for a Smitwicks isn't bad value.The food was very good value with an early bird 3 course steak dinner for €25, and the B&B rate I got was €63. Back to the food, the portions were quite big, but they missed out on the fresh grated parmesan on the caesar salad starter. The steak was a nice size (10oz rib eye) and cooked to perfection, very tender. The only downside with the food was that I found there were too many flavours on the main plate. The sauces were a little overpowering, and the onions seemed to have been sauteed in another very strong flavour. The bar got very busy after dinner with the tour groups, who I found to be quite clannish. The music was good, but I felt he should have waited until the semi final of the Euros were over (Spain V Portugal, I know it went to extra time but it was kind of surreal watching a match with old time waltzes being blasted out). Breakfast was disappointing, they need to provide fresh fruit, and yogurts in pots. Cereal choice was limited. One more thing, they need to put the lights on in Reception, it was very gloomy when I arrived at 5pm. Some signage to show the way to the bar and breakfast wouldn't go astray either. All in all, I enjoyed they stay, and would stay again.
reviews.title: Group on deal

reviews.text: Looks great from outside, modern hotel.
reviews.title: Better Standards at a B&B

reviews.text: When walk through the door it like going back in time to the early 1960's. Dark furniture, worn carpets paint peeling off walls in room, windows that don't close or seal properly. Old double bed no sign of King or Queen beds here.
reviews.title: another visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel has been through the boom years and has not reinvested anything back into the hotel. Shame could be nice hotel.
reviews.title: Clanree weekend

reviews.text: this time it was an overnight sty and the friendliest hotel in the whole of ireland, the staff are kind, friendly and hard workin, the entertainment was as always of a high standard, my room was spotless warm and very comfortable and as for the food ***** yes 5 star i love visiting this hotel and cant wait to go back again
reviews.title: Hotel needs a little work

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The two of us spent a weekend break here. It was easy to get to and just on the edge of town. Its a traditional hotel with pleasant, if oldish, decor. The staff were courteous. The room was of a good standard although if you want a view from your window avoid room 109! There was none! We had dinner in the bar and it was excellent. The hotel was booked out on one of ours nights but we had two quiet nights sleep. Letterkenny is superbly positioned to allow access to the wilder parts of Donegall. We toured around Glenveagh, Mulroy Bay, etc. We did not avail of the sauna and other facilities. One great point for me ( on a sporting weekend) was that the bar had different channels on each of their TV screens. Nice one! Breakfast was traditional and very filling.
reviews.title: NICE DURING COLD WINTER DAYS

reviews.text: We stayed at the Clanree Hotel from June 6th to the 9th this year.
reviews.title: A 'No Frills" Experience
Clean but dated
reviews.text: On arrival we found that we had been booked into a double room instead of a twin .....the booking had been made some time previously.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To be fair to the receptionist she did note that we had requested a twin and she put us in a family room which was huge.
reviews.title: Outdated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were there during a torrential downpour which went on for our entire visit to Donegal......nothing the hotel could do about that but it was very dark in the rooms and the lights didn't help all that much.
reviews.title: nice hotel

reviews.text: The lights looked like they had been stuck down at some point but had been moved and are now loose and rickety.
reviews.title: Nice hotel if you dont like TV..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for one night for a wedding. Wedding food was very good but didn’t eat in the main restaurant. To book with the hotel directly by phone or online was 120euro B&B for a double. They didn’t do a wedding rate and would not accept my perks membership as there was an “event” (the wedding) on that night. After some hunting online I got a room for 85euro. I am VERY glad I didn’t fork out the 120euro!!
reviews.title: Premier Inn of the ‘90’s

reviews.text: Our room was on the main road – as most rooms are. It was furnished in mahogany free standing wardrobe, dresser and 2 bed lockers. The double bed really looked tiny, pillows were flat and it was made up with sheets, blankets and an over throw. Been a while since I had that as most hotels now have a quilt. We had a decent nights sleep and everything was clean. Bathroom had the Dove squeezy bottle by the sink and imperial leather squeezy in the shower – which reminded me of a premier inn (and if I had the choice I’d rather have a premier inn). Sufficient towels, hairdryer and tea/coffee provisions in the room. All the staff were extremely friendly, helpful and accommodating.
reviews.title: A wonderful stay

reviews.text: Location is convenient for Letterkenny, though it's not central and is right on the main road and has no grounds. There are many more quaint places to stay in the perifery or the same standard of hotels on the main street in the centre of town.
reviews.title: nightmare
Enjoyable stay
reviews.text: Stayed as part of the wedding and worked well for us, however I would not plan to stay again. It was satisfactory for us at the rate we got, but it is certainly not worth 120euro per night.

Me and my husband have just left this lovely hotel and I must say we enjoyed the whole experience, from the momment we arrived to leaving we were treated top class the hotel is very clean staff great and food good we had a wonderful room and enjoyed are time spent here
reviews.title: must go!

description: All you could want in a getaway...Plus More!!The Family Friendly Clanree Hotel, Letterkenny, the ideal place to relax and revive. The Clanree Hotel Letterkenny is ideally located for exploring beautiful Donegal and the Northwest of Ireland. Located only a few minutes drive from the bustling town centre of Letterkenny, the hotels accommodation boasts 120 luxurious en-suite rooms. The Aileach restaurant in the Clanree Hotel offers Award Winning food, while McGettigans Bar offers an extensive Bar Food Menu & live entertainment. Visitors can't fail to be impressed by its grand interior and wide range of facilities. The hotel boasts a fully equipped health and fitness club with a heated indoor 20m pool and children's pool, Jacuzzi, sauna, steamroom, solarium and fully-equipped gym. There is an in-house beauty salon providing a full range of treatments and special 'pamper packages' are available throughout the year. What is there to do?....You will not be short of activities in the area from the many coastal drives to mapped walks, horse riding, surfing, fishing, golfing, karting, clay pigeon shooting plus more! Letterkenny town offers great shopping facilities, cinema, theatre and kids jungle gym & bowling. So, I am sure you will agree that the Clanree is the perfect location for midweek breaks, weekend breaks, family breaks, & golden year's breaks...The team at the Clanree Hotel look forward to welcoming you to Donegal.
